intro: Tristemma mauritianum var. rozeiranum, commonly known as the Mauritius tristemma, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in shaded, humid environments. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
